sense.gloss: to step on, to tread on, to trample on
to set foot on (e.g. foreign soil), to stand on, to visit
to experience, to undergo
to follow (rules, principles, etc.), to go through (e.g. formalities), to complete
to estimate, to guess, to judge, to value, to appraise
to rhyme
to succeed to (e.g. the throne)
dance (esp. Western style), dancing
following (a precedent, former policy, etc.), continuing with, sticking to, observing
to step forward, to step forth, to advance
to start, to embark on, to set forth on, to take steps toward
railway crossing, railroad crossing, train crossing, level crossing
starting line, scratch
determination
stepping over the edge of the ring
to take off, to jump, to leap
to take the plunge, to decide, to embark on, to venture into, to launch out into
to step out of the ring
to be based on, to take into account, to build upon, to have origin in
to have one's feet firmly planted on, to plant oneself on
to step into (e.g. someone else's territory), to break into, to raid
to come to grips with, to get to the core of
stepping (in place), stamping (up and down), stomping, marking time (for a soldier)
standstill, stalemate
hustle and bustle, throng, crowd, congestion, traffic jam
to walk in on, to tread upon
stool (stood on to reach high objects), small stepladder
stepping stone
dealing fully (with), going into (issue, etc.), stepping into, breaking or rushing into
alcove
fumi-e, fumie, tablet bearing Christian images, on which Edo-period authorities forced suspected Christians to trample
allegiance test, loyalty test
to brace one's legs, to stand firm, to plant one's feet (firmly on the ground)
to hold out, to persist, to make an effort, to exert oneself
travelling (the full distance) on foot, travelling (all the way) across, travelling through, hiking across, traversing
travelling all over (e.g. a country), visiting all the major locations (of a region, etc.)
rear step out
standing firm, holding out
untrodden, unexplored
to trample underfoot, to tread on, to crush with a foot
determination, decision
masquerade ball
masquerade ball
to miss one's footing
to be off the right track, to be on the wrong path
to tread down so as to harden (soil, snow, etc.)
to trample (down), to crush (by trampling), to ravage
to stay on, to remain, to hold out, to hold one's ground
to stop (doing), to give up
to stamp out (a fire)
to step firmly, to harden by treading
to trample down, to crush underfoot, to kick down
to avoid paying (e.g. a debt), to jump (a bill), to bilk, to shirk
to break by stepping on, to trample, to stomp on, to stamp through
to walk (all the way) across, to traverse (on foot), to travel through, to hike across
to step on (a nail), to run (a nail) through one's foot
to put one's foot through (the floor)
to push through (a crowd, vegetation, etc.)
to lie on one's back with legs outstretched, to recline
to get cocky, to be arrogant
survey, exploration, field investigation
to hesitate, to think twice, to flinch, to get cold feet
treading wheat plants
ball, dance
dance music
unexplored
unexplored
leather-soled sandals (geta)
untrodden (region, field of study, etc.), unprecedented (discovery, achievement, etc.)
appraisal, estimation, evaluation, setting prices
treadmill
to trample down, to tread on
to ignore, to spurn
to stamp one's feet
trampling down
ball room, dance room
ball dress, dancing clothes

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓は↑危険↑↓きけん↓な↑領域↑↓りょういき↓に↑踏↑↓ふ↓み↑込↑↓こ↓んでいるよ。
sdata.e: You're stepping into dangerous territory.

sdata.j: ↑君↑↓きみ↓に↑会↑↓あ↓い↑損↑↓そこ↓ねて↑地団駄↑↓じだんだ↓を↑踏↑↓ふ↓んだよ。
sdata.e: I was chagrined at missing you.

sdata.j: ↑極小↑↓きょくしょう↓の↑虫↑↓むし↓でも↑踏↑↓ふ↓まれれば、そりくり↑返↑↓かえ↓る。
sdata.e: Even the smallest worm will turn if trodden on.

sdata.j: ↑机↑↓つくえ↓の↑上↑↓じょう↓に↑舞踏↑↓ぶとう↓についての↑本↑↓ほん↓がある。
sdata.e: There is a book on dancing on the desk.

sdata.j: ↑割↑↓わ↓れたガラスを↑踏↑↓ふ↓むな。
sdata.e: Don't step on the broken glass.

sdata.j: ↑階段↑↓かいだん↓を↑踏↑↓ふ↓みはずして↑足首↑↓あしくび↓を↑捻挫↑↓ねんざ↓したようです。
sdata.e: I missed a step on the stairs and I'm afraid I sprained my ankle.

sdata.j: ↑何↑↓なに↓をするにも↑順序↑↓じゅんじょ↓を↑踏↑↓ふ↓んでやりなさい。
sdata.e: No matter what you do, you must follow the correct order.

sdata.j: ↑雨↑↓あめ↓には↑降↑↓ふ↓られるわ、デートに↑遅刻↑↓ちこく↓するわ、↑財布↑↓さいふ↓を↑落↑↓お↓とすわ、↑今日↑↓きょう↓は↑踏↑↓ふ↓んだり↑蹴↑↓け↓ったりだよ。
sdata.e: I get caught in the rain, I'm late for my date, and I lose my pocketbook. It's just one thing after another today.

sdata.j: ↑踏↑↓ふ↓んだり↑蹴↑↓け↓ったり。
sdata.e: When it rains, it pours.

sdata.j: ↑一↑↓いち↓↑歩↑↓ほ↓↑踏↑↓ふ↓み↑出↑↓だ↓せば↑半分↑↓はんぶん↓↑終↑↓お↓わったも↑同↑↓おな↓じ。
sdata.e: The first step is as good as half over.

sdata.j: もう↑一↑↓ひと↓↑踏↑↓ふ↓ん↑張↑↓ば↓り！
sdata.e: Stick to it!

sdata.j: ミミズを↑踏↑↓ふ↓むと↑雨↑↓あめ↓が↑降↑↓ふ↓るという↑人↑↓ひと↓がいる。
sdata.e: Some people say stepping on a worm makes it rain.

sdata.j: また、「↑安楽↑↓あんらく↓いすに↑座↑↓すわ↓りながらの↑買↑↓か↓い↑物↑↓もの↓」には、↑雑踏↑↓ざっとう↓や↑交通↑↓こうつう↓から↑来↑↓く↓るフラストレーションが↑伴↑↓ともな↓わない。
sdata.e: Also, "armchair shopping" gets rid of the frustrations of crowds and traffic.

sdata.j: ペダルを↑踏↑↓ふ↓むたびごとに、↑車輪↑↓しゃりん↓が↑一↑↓いち↓↑回転↑↓かいてん↓する。
sdata.e: Each time you step on the pedal, the wheel turns once.

sdata.j: ダンサーたちは↑楽団↑↓がくだん↓の↑音楽↑↓おんがく↓にあわせてステップを↑踏↑↓ふ↓んだ。
sdata.e: The dancers timed their steps to the music of the band.

sdata.j: それを↑実験↑↓じっけん↓するのは↑薄氷↑↓はくひょう↓を↑踏↑↓ふ↓む↑思↑↓おも↓いだったよ。
sdata.e: While I was at it, I felt as if I was walking on thin ice.

sdata.j: その↑男↑↓おとこ↓は↑私↑↓わたし↓の↑足↑↓あし↓を↑踏↑↓ふ↓んだのにわびることさえしなかった。
sdata.e: The man did not so much as apologize for stepping on my foot.

sdata.j: その↑条約↑↓じょうやく↓が↑踏↑↓ふ↓みにじられて↑戦争↑↓せんそう↓が↑起↑↓お↓こった。
sdata.e: War broke out when the treaty was ignored.

sdata.j: その↑少年↑↓しょうねん↓はわざと↑私↑↓わたし↓の↑足↑↓あし↓を↑踏↑↓ふ↓んだ。
sdata.e: The boy stepped on my foot on purpose.

sdata.j: その↑岩↑↓いわ↓を↑踏↑↓ふ↓んではいけない。↑落↑↓お↓ちそうだ。
sdata.e: Don't step on that rock. It's going to fall.

sdata.j: その↑運転↑↓うんてん↓↑手↑↓しゅ↓は、まるっきり↑違↑↓ちが↓う↑街↑↓まち↓の↑間違↑↓まちが↓った↑球場↑↓きゅうじょう↓にチームを↑運↑↓はこ↓んで↑行↑↓い↓ってしまうという↑大↑↓だい↓ドジを↑踏↑↓ふ↓んでしまった。
sdata.e: The driver really screwed up the team when he drove them to the wrong playing field in a different town.

sdata.j: ざくざくと↑雪↑↓ゆき↓を↑踏↑↓ふ↓んで↑進↑↓すす↓む。
sdata.e: I crunch through the snow.

sdata.j: この↑踏台↑↓ふみだい↓を↑使↑↓つか↓えばクローゼットの↑上↑↓じょう↓に↑手↑↓て↓が↑届↑↓とど↓くよ。
sdata.e: If you stand on this stool, you can reach the top of the closet.

sdata.j: この↑段階↑↓だんかい↓を↑踏↑↓ふ↓まえ、↑抑圧↑↓よくあつ↓という↑概念↑↓がいねん↓をさらに↑詳細↑↓しょうさい↓に↑検証↑↓けんしょう↓していくことになります。
sdata.e: From this point we go on to an even more detailed examination of the concept of repression.

sdata.j: いたずらっ↑子↑↓こ↓にすっかり↑花壇↑↓かだん↓を↑踏↑↓ふ↓み↑荒↑↓あ↓らした。
sdata.e: My flower garden was trampled by urchins.

sdata.j: ↑君子↑↓くんし↓が↑恐↑↓おそ↓れて↑踏↑↓ふ↓み↑込↑↓こ↓まぬ↑所↑↓ところ↓へも↑愚者↑↓ぐしゃ↓は↑突入↑↓とつにゅう↓する。
sdata.e: Fools rush in where angels fear to tread.

sdata.j: ↑群衆↑↓ぐんしゅう↓に↑押↑↓お↓されないよう↑力↑↓りょく↓を↑入↑↓い↓れて↑踏↑↓ふ↓ん↑張↑↓ば↓った。
sdata.e: I braced myself against the crowd.

sdata.j: ↑警報↑↓けいほう↓↑機↑↓き↓が↑鳴↑↓な↓っているときは↑絶対↑↓ぜったい↓に↑踏切↑↓ふみきり↓を↑渡↑↓わた↓らないでください。
sdata.e: Don't go onto the crossing when the alarm is ringing.

sdata.j: ↑混雑↑↓こんざつ↓したバスの↑中↑↓なか↓で↑私↑↓わたし↓は↑誰↑↓だれ↓かにつま↑先↑↓さき↓を↑踏↑↓ふ↓まれた。
sdata.e: Someone stepped on my toe in the crowded bus.

sdata.j: ↑私↑↓わたし↓が↑足↑↓あし↓を↑踏↑↓ふ↓むと↑犬↑↓いぬ↓は↑鳴↑↓な↓いた。
sdata.e: The dog gave a yelp when I trod on its paw.
